name: Lars Ulrich
description:
'''Lars Ulrich''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|ʊ|l|r|ɪ|k|audio=en-us-Ulrich.oga}}; {{IPA|da|ˈlɑːs ˈulˀʁek|lang}}; born 26 December 1963) is a Danish{{efn|Ulrich has clarified multiple times that he is only a Danish citizen who lives permanently in the United States.<ref>{{cite web|title=Lars Ulrich: Jeg flytter hjem hvis ...|url=https://ekstrabladet.dk/musik/dkmusiknyt/lars-ulrich-jeg-flytter-hjem-hvis/6312835|quote="Nej, jeg er hundrede procent dansk statsborger"/"No, I am one hundred percent Danish citizen"|first=Thomas|last=Treo|publisher=[[Ekstra Bladet]]|date=26 September 2016|access-date=6 December 2017|language=da}}</ref><ref name=":0">{{cite web|url=https://blabbermouth.net/news/metallicas-lars-ulrich-on-whom-he-would-vote-for-in-2020-u-s-presidential-election-fans-out-there-can-probably-put-two-and-two-together|title=METALLICA's LARS ULRICH On Whom He Would Vote For In 2020 U.S. Presidential Election: 'Fans Out There Can Probably Put Two And Two Together'|date=3 September 2020|quote=So, let's just leave it at that I'm a Danish citizen, I can't vote, but I am happy to live in the United States. And I think that's enough on that.}}</ref>}} musician who is the drummer and a founding member of American [[Heavy metal music|heavy metal]] band [[Metallica]]. Along with [[James Hetfield]], Ulrich has songwriting credits on almost all of the band's songs, and the two of them are the only remaining original members of the band.

The son and grandson respectively of [[tennis]] players [[Torben Ulrich|Torben]] and [[Einer Ulrich]], he played tennis in his youth and moved to [[Los Angeles]] at age 16 to train professionally. However, rather than playing tennis, Ulrich began playing drums. After publishing an advertisement in ''[[The Recycler]]'', Ulrich met Hetfield and formed Metallica.
